index.html.title: Non-euclidean VR
index.html.name: Non-euclidean VR
index.html.summary: First person exploration of Thurston's geoemtries

ShaderBuilder.html.title: ShaderBuilder
ShaderBuilder.html.name: ShaderBuilder
ShaderBuilder.html.description: Tool to build shaders without redundancies in the imported chunks of code

ShaderBuilder.html#includedImports.title: includedImports :Array.<string>
ShaderBuilder.html#includedImports.name: includedImports
ShaderBuilder.html#includedImports.description: The list of shader imports already included.

ShaderBuilder.html#includedClasses.title: includedClasses :Array.<string>
ShaderBuilder.html#includedClasses.name: includedClasses
ShaderBuilder.html#includedClasses.description: The list of classes already included.

ShaderBuilder.html#includedUniforms.title: includedUniforms :Array.<string>
ShaderBuilder.html#includedUniforms.name: includedUniforms
ShaderBuilder.html#includedUniforms.description: List of names of uniforms already included

ShaderBuilder.html#includedInstances.title: includedInstances :Array.<string>
ShaderBuilder.html#includedInstances.name: includedInstances
ShaderBuilder.html#includedInstances.description: List of names of instances already included

ShaderBuilder.html#uniforms.title: uniforms :Object
ShaderBuilder.html#uniforms.name: uniforms
ShaderBuilder.html#uniforms.description: An object with all the uniforms to pass to the shader.

ShaderBuilder.html#addChunk.title: addChunk( code )  {ShaderBuilder}
ShaderBuilder.html#addChunk.name: addChunk
ShaderBuilder.html#addChunk.description: Add the given chunk (without any prior test)

ShaderBuilder.html#addImport.title: addImport( imp )  {ShaderBuilder}
ShaderBuilder.html#addImport.name: addImport
ShaderBuilder.html#addImport.description: Incorporate the given import (if it does not already exists)

ShaderBuilder.html#addClass.title: addClass( name, code )  {ShaderBuilder}
ShaderBuilder.html#addClass.name: addClass
ShaderBuilder.html#addClass.description: Incorporate the given dependency (if it does not already exists)

ShaderBuilder.html#addUniform.title: addUniform( name, type, value )  {ShaderBuilder}
ShaderBuilder.html#addUniform.name: addUniform
ShaderBuilder.html#addUniform.description: Add a uniform variable to the shader code. Update the object listing all the uniforms

ShaderBuilder.html#updateUniform.title: updateUniform( name, value )  {ShaderBuilder}
ShaderBuilder.html#updateUniform.name: updateUniform
ShaderBuilder.html#updateUniform.description: Update the value of a previously defined uniform

ShaderBuilder.html#addInstance.title: addInstance( name, code )  {ShaderBuilder}
ShaderBuilder.html#addInstance.name: addInstance
ShaderBuilder.html#addInstance.description: Add the given code (related to a specific instance of a class). Check before (using name) that the code has not been included before.

Isometry.html#build.title: <abstract> build()
Isometry.html#build.name: build
Isometry.html#build.description: Fake constructor If no argument is passed, return the identity.

Isometry.html#reduceError.title: <abstract> reduceError()  {Isometry}
Isometry.html#reduceError.name: reduceError
Isometry.html#reduceError.description: Reduce the eventual numerical errors of the current isometry (typically Gram-Schmidt).

Isometry.html#multiply.title: <abstract> multiply( isom )  {Isometry}
Isometry.html#multiply.name: multiply
Isometry.html#multiply.description: Multiply the current isometry by isom on the left, i.e. replace this by this * isom.

Isometry.html#premultiply.title: <abstract> premultiply( isom )  {Isometry}
Isometry.html#premultiply.name: premultiply
Isometry.html#premultiply.description: Multiply the current isometry by isom on the right, i.e. replace this by isom * this.

Isometry.html#makeTranslation.title: <abstract> makeTranslation( point )  {Isometry}
Isometry.html#makeTranslation.name: makeTranslation
Isometry.html#makeTranslation.description: Return a preferred isometry sending the origin to the given point (typically in Nil, Sol, SL2, etc).

Isometry.html#makeInvTranslation.title: <abstract> makeInvTranslation( point )  {Isometry}
Isometry.html#makeInvTranslation.name: makeInvTranslation
Isometry.html#makeInvTranslation.description: Return a preferred isometry sending the given point to the origin (typically in Nil, Sol, SL2, etc).

Isometry.html#makeTranslationFromDir.title: <abstract> makeTranslationFromDir( vec )  {Isometry}
Isometry.html#makeTranslationFromDir.name: makeTranslationFromDir
Isometry.html#makeTranslationFromDir.description: Return a preferred isometry sending the origin to the image of v by the exponential map.

Isometry.html#equals.title: <abstract> equals( isom )  {boolean}
Isometry.html#equals.name: equals
Isometry.html#equals.description: Check if the current isometry and isom are the same. Mainly for debugging purposes.

Isometry.html#clone.title: <abstract> clone()  {Isometry}
Isometry.html#clone.name: clone
Isometry.html#clone.description: Return a new copy of the current isometry.

Isometry.html#copy.title: <abstract> copy( isom )  {Isometry}
Isometry.html#copy.name: copy
Isometry.html#copy.description: Set the current isometry with the given isometry

Isometry.html#toGLSL.title: <abstract> toGLSL()  {string}
Isometry.html#toGLSL.name: toGLSL
Isometry.html#toGLSL.description: Return a block of GLSL code creating the same isometry Used when dynamically building shaders.

Point.html#build.title: <abstract> build()
Point.html#build.name: build
Point.html#build.description: Fake constructor. If no argument is passed, return the origin of the space.

Point.html#set.title: set()
Point.html#set.name: set
Point.html#set.description: Set the coordinates of the point

Point.html#applyIsometry.title: <abstract> applyIsometry( isom )  {Point}
Point.html#applyIsometry.name: applyIsometry
Point.html#applyIsometry.description: Translate the current point by the given isometry.

Point.html#equals.title: <abstract> equals( point )  {boolean}
Point.html#equals.name: equals
Point.html#equals.description: Check if the current point and point are the same. Mainly for debugging purposes.

Point.html#clone.title: <abstract> clone()  {Point}
Point.html#clone.name: clone
Point.html#clone.description: Return a new copy of the current point.

Point.html#copy.title: <abstract> copy( point )  {Point}
Point.html#copy.name: copy
Point.html#copy.description: set the current point with the given point

Point.html#toGLSL.title: <abstract> toGLSL()  {string}
Point.html#toGLSL.name: toGLSL
Point.html#toGLSL.description: Return a line of GLSL code creating the same point. Used when dynamically building shaders.

Stereo.html.title: Stereo
Stereo.html.name: Stereo
Stereo.html.description: Class to add eventually some "distortion" to the stereo Typically used in H3 (tourist vs native view)

Stereo.html#switch.title: switch()
Stereo.html#switch.name: switch
Stereo.html#switch.description: Turn the stereo mode on or off

Stereo.html#eyes.title: eyes( cameraMatrix, position )  {Array.<RelPosition>}
Stereo.html#eyes.name: eyes
Stereo.html#eyes.description: Return the two positions corresponding to the left and right eye. The method just offset the eyes using parallel transport.

FixedDirectionStereo.html.title: FixedDirectionStereo
FixedDirectionStereo.html.name: FixedDirectionStereo
FixedDirectionStereo.html.description: For development purpose: a stereo mode where the scene is fixed (even if the user turns the head)

Mono.html.title: Mono
Mono.html.name: Mono
Mono.html.description: Class to add eventually some "distortion" to the stereo Typically used in H3 (tourist vs native view)

Light.html#isLight.title: isLight :boolean
Light.html#isLight.name: isLight
Light.html#isLight.description: Says that the object inherits from Light

Light.html#glslDirections.title: <abstract> glslDirections()  {string}
Light.html#glslDirections.name: glslDirections
Light.html#glslDirections.description: Return the chunk of GLSL code corresponding to the direction field.

Light.html#glslInstance.title: glslInstance()  {string}
Light.html#glslInstance.name: glslInstance
Light.html#glslInstance.description: Compile all the function directly related to the object (e.g. direction field).

Material.html#isMaterial.title: isMaterial :boolean
Material.html#isMaterial.name: isMaterial
Material.html#isMaterial.description: Says that the object inherits from Material

Material.html#isGlobal.title: isGlobal :boolean
Material.html#isGlobal.name: isGlobal
Material.html#isGlobal.description: Says whether the shape is global. This property does not make sense for material.

Material.html#isLocal.title: isLocal :boolean
Material.html#isLocal.name: isLocal
Material.html#isLocal.description: Says whether the shape is local. True if local, false otherwise

Material.html#glslRender.title: <abstract> glslRender()  {string}
Material.html#glslRender.name: glslRender
Material.html#glslRender.description: Return the chunk of GLSL code used to compute the color of the material at the given point

Material.html#glslInstance.title: glslInstance()  {string}
Material.html#glslInstance.name: glslInstance
Material.html#glslInstance.description: Compile all the function directly related to the object (e.g. render).

NativeStereo.html.title: NativeStereo
NativeStereo.html.name: NativeStereo
NativeStereo.html.description: Native view in hyperbolic three-space. The terminology comes from Jeff Weeks.

Generic.html.title: <abstract> Generic
Generic.html.name: Generic
Generic.html.description: Generic class for Shape, Material, Solid, etc. Factorize ID Management and other stuff.

Generic.html#uuid.title: <readonly> uuid :string
Generic.html#uuid.name: uuid
Generic.html#uuid.description: Universal unique ID. The dashes are replaced by underscored to avoid problems in the shaders

Generic.html#id.title: <readonly> id
Generic.html#id.name: id
Generic.html#id.description: ID of the object in the scene This number is computed automatically when the object is added to the scene. It should not be changed

Generic.html#imports.title: imports :Array.<string>
Generic.html#imports.name: imports
Generic.html#imports.description: A list of GLSL code chunks that are needed for this shape (and could also be reused somewhere else). Default is the empty list.

Generic.html#className.title: className
Generic.html#className.name: className
Generic.html#className.description: The name of the class. Useful to generate the name of items

Generic.html#name.title: name :string
Generic.html#name.name: name
Generic.html#name.description: The name of the item. This name is computed (from the uuid) the first time the getter is called.

Generic.html#isGlobal.title: isGlobal :boolean
Generic.html#isGlobal.name: isGlobal
Generic.html#isGlobal.description: Says whether the shape is global. True if global, false otherwise.

Generic.html#isLocal.title: isLocal :boolean
Generic.html#isLocal.name: isLocal
Generic.html#isLocal.description: Says whether the shape is local. True if local, false otherwise

Generic.html#uniformType.title: uniformType
Generic.html#uniformType.name: uniformType
Generic.html#uniformType.description: Return the type under which the data is passed as uniform. Return the empty string, if the data should not be passed as a uniform.

Generic.html#setId.title: setId( id )  {number}
Generic.html#setId.name: setId
Generic.html#setId.description: Set the ID of the shape. Propagate the process if needed

Generic.html#.glslClass.title: <abstract, static> glslClass()  {string}
Generic.html#.glslClass.name: glslClass
Generic.html#.glslClass.description: Return the chunk of GLSL code defining the corresponding structure, And eventually basic functions associated to the structure.

Generic.html#glslInstance.title: glslInstance()  {string}
Generic.html#glslInstance.name: glslInstance
Generic.html#glslInstance.description: Compile all the function directly related to the instance of the class (e.g. sdf, gradient, direction field, etc).

Generic.html#shader.title: shader( shaderBuilder )
Generic.html#shader.name: shader
Generic.html#shader.description: Extend the given shader with the appropriate code

Teleport.html.title: Teleport
Teleport.html.name: Teleport
Teleport.html.description: Elementary brick of a discrete subgroups. We describe a discrete subgroups by a set of generators. Each generator is seen as a "teleportation" (to move a point back in the fundamental domain). A Teleport encode both the generator, and the test to decide if a teleportation is needed.

Teleport.html#jsTest.title: jsTest :function
Teleport.html#jsTest.name: jsTest
Teleport.html#jsTest.description: A JS test saying if a teleportation is needed The test is a function with the signature Point -> boolean The test returns true if a teleportation is needed and false otherwise.

Teleport.html#glslTest.title: glslTest :string
Teleport.html#glslTest.name: glslTest
Teleport.html#glslTest.description: A GLSL test saying if a teleportation is needed The test returns true if a teleportation is needed and false otherwise.

Teleport.html#isom.title: isom :Isometry
Teleport.html#isom.name: isom
Teleport.html#isom.description: The isometry to apply when teleporting

Teleport.html#inv.title: inv :Isometry
Teleport.html#inv.name: inv
Teleport.html#inv.description: The inverse of the teleporting isometry

Teleport.html#name.title: name
Teleport.html#name.name: name
Teleport.html#name.description: The name of the JS test function serves as name/ID for the Teleport

Shape.html.title: <abstract> Shape
Shape.html.name: Shape
Shape.html.description: A representation of a 3D geometric shape. It should not be confused with Three.js Shape class. It is more an analogue of the class BufferGeometry in Three.js.

Shape.html#isShape.title: isShape :boolean
Shape.html#isShape.name: isShape
Shape.html#isShape.description: Says that the object inherits from Shape

Shape.html#isBasicShape.title: isBasicShape :boolean
Shape.html#isBasicShape.name: isBasicShape
Shape.html#isBasicShape.description: Says whether the shape is a basic shape, that it is not build on top of other shapes.

Shape.html#isAdvancedShape.title: isAdvancedShape :boolean
Shape.html#isAdvancedShape.name: isAdvancedShape
Shape.html#isAdvancedShape.description: Says whether the shape is a basic shape, that it is not build on top of other shapes.

Shape.html#glslSDF.title: <abstract> glslSDF()  {string}
Shape.html#glslSDF.name: glslSDF
Shape.html#glslSDF.description: Return the chunk of GLSL code corresponding to the signed distance function.

Shape.html#glslGradient.title: <abstract> glslGradient()  {string}
Shape.html#glslGradient.name: glslGradient
Shape.html#glslGradient.description: Return the chunk of GLSL code corresponding to the gradient field.

Shape.html#glslInstance.title: glslInstance()  {string}
Shape.html#glslInstance.name: glslInstance
Shape.html#glslInstance.description: Compile all the function directly related to the object (e.g. sdf, gradient, etc).

Solid.html.title: Solid
Solid.html.name: Solid
Solid.html.description: Abstract class for solids. Unlike shapes, materials or lights, solids have no existence as a structure on the shader side. This comes from the fact that the type of shape / material may vary. As a consequence, solids do not have a numerical ID, just a UUID.

Solid.html#isSolid.title: isSolid :boolean
Solid.html#isSolid.name: isSolid
Solid.html#isSolid.description: Say if the item is a solid

Solid.html#setId.title: setId( id )  {number}
Solid.html#setId.name: setId
Solid.html#setId.description: Set the ID of the shape and material

Solid.html#glslInstance.title: glslInstance()  {string}
Solid.html#glslInstance.name: glslInstance
Solid.html#glslInstance.description: Compile all the function directly related to the object (e.g. sdf, gradient, direction field, etc).

Camera.html.title: Camera
Camera.html.name: Camera
Camera.html.description: Camera in the non-euclidean scene. It should not be confused with the Three.js camera in the virtual euclidean scene

Camera.html#maxSteps.title: maxSteps :number
Camera.html#maxSteps.name: maxSteps
Camera.html#maxSteps.description: Maximal number of steps during the ray-marching

Camera.html#aspect.title: aspect
Camera.html#aspect.name: aspect
Camera.html#aspect.description: Shortcut to reset the aspect of the underlying Three.js camera

Camera.html#fov.title: fov
Camera.html#fov.name: fov
Camera.html#fov.description: Shortcut to reset the field of view of the underlying Three.js camera

Camera.html#matrix.title: matrix :Matrix4
Camera.html#matrix.name: matrix
Camera.html#matrix.description: Matrix of the underlying Three.js camera in the virtual euclidean scene

Camera.html#updateProjectionMatrix.title: updateProjectionMatrix()
Camera.html#updateProjectionMatrix.name: updateProjectionMatrix
Camera.html#updateProjectionMatrix.description: Shortcut to update the projection matrix of the underlying Three.js camera

Camera.html#shader.title: shader( shaderBuilder )
Camera.html#shader.name: shader
Camera.html#shader.description: build the GLSL code needed to declare the camera

NormalMaterial.html.title: NormalMaterial
NormalMaterial.html.name: NormalMaterial
NormalMaterial.html.description: A material that maps the normal vectors to RGB colors.

NormalMaterial.html#isMaterial.title: isMaterial :boolean
NormalMaterial.html#isMaterial.name: isMaterial

NormalMaterial.html#isGlobal.title: isGlobal :boolean
NormalMaterial.html#isGlobal.name: isGlobal

NormalMaterial.html#isLocal.title: isLocal :boolean
NormalMaterial.html#isLocal.name: isLocal

NormalMaterial.html#glslInstance.name: glslInstance

SingleColorMaterial.html.title: SingleColorMaterial
SingleColorMaterial.html.name: SingleColorMaterial
SingleColorMaterial.html.description: A material that display a single plain color

SingleColorMaterial.html#isMaterial.title: isMaterial :boolean
SingleColorMaterial.html#isMaterial.name: isMaterial
SingleColorMaterial.html#isMaterial.description: Says that the object inherits from Material

SingleColorMaterial.html#isGlobal.title: isGlobal :boolean
SingleColorMaterial.html#isGlobal.name: isGlobal
SingleColorMaterial.html#isGlobal.description: Says whether the shape is global. This property does not make sense for material.

SingleColorMaterial.html#isLocal.title: isLocal :boolean
SingleColorMaterial.html#isLocal.name: isLocal

SingleColorMaterial.html#glslInstance.description: Compile all the function directly related to the object (e.g. render).

Position.html.title: Position
Position.html.name: Position
Position.html.description: Location and facing (of the observer, an object, etc).

Position.html#boost.title: boost :Isometry
Position.html#boost.name: boost
Position.html#boost.description: The isometry component of the position.

Position.html#quaternion.title: quaternion
Position.html#quaternion.name: quaternion
Position.html#quaternion.description: The facing. We represent it as quaternion, whose action by conjugation on R^3 defines an element of O(3)

Position.html#facing.title: facing :Matrix4
Position.html#facing.name: facing
Position.html#facing.description: The facing as a Matrix4, representing an element of O(3). This is the data that is actually passed to the shader

Position.html#setBoost.title: setBoost( isom )  {Position}
Position.html#setBoost.name: setBoost
Position.html#setBoost.description: Set the boost part of the position.

Position.html#setQuaternion.title: setQuaternion( quaternion )  {Position}
Position.html#setQuaternion.name: setQuaternion
Position.html#setQuaternion.description: Set the facing part of the position.

Position.html#reduceErrorBoost.title: reduceErrorBoost()  {Position}
Position.html#reduceErrorBoost.name: reduceErrorBoost
Position.html#reduceErrorBoost.description: Reduce the eventual numerical error of the current boost.

Position.html#reduceErrorQuaternion.title: reduceErrorQuaternion()  {Position}
Position.html#reduceErrorQuaternion.name: reduceErrorQuaternion
Position.html#reduceErrorQuaternion.description: Make the the quaternion has length one.

Position.html#reduceError.title: reduceError()  {Position}
Position.html#reduceError.name: reduceError
Position.html#reduceError.description: Reduce the error of the boost part and the quaternion part.

Position.html#applyIsometry.title: applyIsometry( isom )  {Position}
Position.html#applyIsometry.name: applyIsometry
Position.html#applyIsometry.description: Translate the current position by isom (left action of the isometry group G on the set of positions).

Position.html#applyQuaternion.title: applyQuaternion( quaternion )  {Position}
Position.html#applyQuaternion.name: applyQuaternion
Position.html#applyQuaternion.description: Rotate the facing by m (right action of O(3) in the set of positions).

Position.html#multiply.title: multiply( position )  {Position}
Position.html#multiply.name: multiply
Position.html#multiply.description: Multiply the current position (g0,m0) on the right by the given position (g,m), i.e. return (g0 * g, m * m0)

Position.html#premultiply.title: premultiply( position )  {Position}
Position.html#premultiply.name: premultiply
Position.html#premultiply.description: Multiply the current position (g0,m0) on the left by the given position (g,m), i.e. return (g * g0, m0 * m)

Position.html#invert.title: invert()  {Position}
Position.html#invert.name: invert
Position.html#invert.description: Set the current position to its inverse

Position.html#flowFromOrigin.title: <abstract> flowFromOrigin( v )  {Position}
Position.html#flowFromOrigin.name: flowFromOrigin
Position.html#flowFromOrigin.description: Replace the current position, by the one obtained by flow the initial position (id, id) in the direction v (given in the reference frame).

Position.html#flow.title: flow( v )  {Position}
Position.html#flow.name: flow
Position.html#flow.description: Flow the current position. v is the pull back at the origin by the position of the direction in which we flow The time by which we flow is the norm of v. The procedure goes as follows. Let e = (e1, e2, e3) be the reference frame in the tangent space at the origin. Assume that the current position is (g,m) The vector v = (v1, v2, v3) is given in the observer frame, that is v = d_og m u, where u = u1 . e1 + u2 . e2 + u3 . e3. We first pull back the data at the origin by the inverse of g. We compute the position (g',m') obtained from the initial position (id, id) by flowing in the direction w = m u. This position send the frame m e to d_o g' . m ' . m . e We move everything back using g, so that the new observer frame is d_o (gg') . m' . m e. Hence the new position (gg', m'm) is obtained by multiplying (g,m) and (g',m')

Position.html#equals.title: equals( position )  {boolean}
Position.html#equals.name: equals
Position.html#equals.description: Check if the current position and position are the same.

Position.html#clone.title: clone()  {Position}
Position.html#clone.name: clone
Position.html#clone.description: Return a new copy of the current position.

Position.html#copy.title: copy( position )  {Position}
Position.html#copy.name: copy
Position.html#copy.description: Set the current position with the given one.

Position.html#toGLSL.title: toGLSL()  {string}
Position.html#toGLSL.name: toGLSL
Position.html#toGLSL.description: Return a line of GLSL code creating the same position. Used when dynamically building shaders.

Scene.html.title: Scene
Scene.html.name: Scene
Scene.html.description: Non-euclidean scene. All the objects added to the scene should belong to the same geometry

Scene.html#_lights.title: <private> _lights :Array.<Light>
Scene.html#_lights.name: _lights
Scene.html#_lights.description: List of all the lights in the scene.

Scene.html#_solids.title: <private> _solids :Array.<Solid>
Scene.html#_solids.name: _solids
Scene.html#_solids.description: List of all the solids in the scene.

Scene.html#_nextId.title: <private> _nextId :number
Scene.html#_nextId.name: _nextId
Scene.html#_nextId.description: Next available ID in the scene.

Scene.html#_add.title: _add( obj )  {Scene}
Scene.html#_add.name: _add
Scene.html#_add.description: Add exactly one object to the scene

Scene.html#add.title: add( ...obj )  {Scene}
Scene.html#add.name: add
Scene.html#add.description: Add one or more object in the scene

Scene.html#shader.title: shader( shaderBuilder )
Scene.html#shader.name: shader

AdvancedShape.html.title: <abstract> AdvancedShape
AdvancedShape.html.name: AdvancedShape
AdvancedShape.html.description: A representation of 3D advanced shapes. An advanced shape is a shape that is built on top of other shapes. The types of the properties of an advanced shape may depend on the instance of this shape. Theses properties will not be passed to the shader. Only the signed distance function will carry the relevant data.

AdvancedShape.html#isBasicShape.title: isBasicShape :boolean
AdvancedShape.html#isBasicShape.name: isBasicShape
AdvancedShape.html#isBasicShape.description: Says whether the shape is a basic shape, that it is not build on top of other shapes.

BasicShape.html.title: <abstract> BasicShape
BasicShape.html.name: BasicShape
BasicShape.html.description: A representation of 3D basic shape. A basic shape is a shape that is not built on top of other shapes. The types of the properties of a basic shape should not depend on the instance of this shape. Indeed these properties will be passed to the shader in the form of a struct. (This gives the options to animate the shapes.)

BasicShape.html#isBasicShape.title: isBasicShape :boolean
BasicShape.html#isBasicShape.name: isBasicShape
BasicShape.html#isBasicShape.description: Says whether the shape is a basic shape, that it is not build on top of other shapes.

PointLight.html#isGlobal.title: isGlobal :boolean
PointLight.html#isGlobal.name: isGlobal
PointLight.html#isGlobal.description: Says whether the shape is global. True if global, false otherwise.

PointLight.html#isLocal.title: isLocal :boolean
PointLight.html#isLocal.name: isLocal
PointLight.html#isLocal.description: Says whether the shape is local. True if local, false otherwise

PointLight.html#.glslClass.title: <abstract, static> glslClass()  {string}
PointLight.html#.glslClass.name: glslClass
PointLight.html#.glslClass.description: Return the chunk of GLSL code defining the corresponding structure.

BallShape.html#isBallShape.title: isBallShape :boolean
BallShape.html#isBallShape.name: isBallShape
BallShape.html#isBallShape.description: Says that the object inherits from Ball

BallShape.html#isGlobal.title: isGlobal :boolean
BallShape.html#isGlobal.name: isGlobal
BallShape.html#isGlobal.description: Says whether the shape is global. True if global, false otherwise.

LocalBallShape.html.title: LocalBallShape
LocalBallShape.html.name: LocalBallShape
LocalBallShape.html.description: Shape of a euclidean local ball

LocalBallShape.html#isLocalBallShape.title: isLocalBallShape :boolean
LocalBallShape.html#isLocalBallShape.name: isLocalBallShape
LocalBallShape.html#isLocalBallShape.description: Says that the object inherits from Ball

LocalBallShape.html#isGlobal.title: isGlobal :boolean

Vector.html.title: Vector
Vector.html.name: Vector
Vector.html.description: Tangent vector at the origin written in the reference frame. Are available form three.js: all the linear algebra the length of a vector

Vector.html#toLog.title: toLog()  {string}
Vector.html#toLog.name: toLog
Vector.html#toLog.description: Add a method to Three.js Vector3. Return a human-readable version of the vector (for debugging purpose)

Vector.html#applyMatrix4.title: applyMatrix4( m )  {Vector}
Vector.html#applyMatrix4.name: applyMatrix4
Vector.html#applyMatrix4.description: Overload Three.js applyMatrix4. Indeed Three.js considers the Vector3 as a 3D point It multiplies the vector (with an implicit 1 in the 4th dimension) and m, and divides by perspective. Here the data represents a vector, thus the implicit 4th coordinate is 0

Vector.html#applyFacing.title: applyFacing( position )  {Vector}
Vector.html#applyFacing.name: applyFacing
Vector.html#applyFacing.description: Rotate the current vector by the facing component of the position. This method is geometry independent as the coordinates of the vector are given in a chosen reference frame. Only the reference frame depends on the geometry.

Vector.html#toGLSL.title: toGLSL()  {string}
Vector.html#toGLSL.name: toGLSL
Vector.html#toGLSL.description: Add a method to Three.js Vector3. Return a block of GLSL code recreating the same vector as a vec3

RelPosition.html.title: RelPosition
RelPosition.html.name: RelPosition
RelPosition.html.description: Relative position. A general position is represented as a pair (h,p) where h (cellBoost) is an Isometry representing an element of a discrete subgroups p (local) is a Position The frame represented by the relative position is the image by h of the frame represented by the position p We split the isometry part (hg) in two pieces. The idea is to g should gives a position in the fundamental domain of the (implicit) underlying lattice. This will keep the coordinates of g in a bounded range. For simplicity we also keep track of the inverse of the cellBoost.

RelPosition.html#cellBoost.title: cellBoost :Isometry
RelPosition.html#cellBoost.name: cellBoost
RelPosition.html#cellBoost.description: the "discrete" component of the isometry par of the boost

RelPosition.html#sbgp.title: sbgp :Subgroup
RelPosition.html#sbgp.name: sbgp
RelPosition.html#sbgp.description: the isometry component of the position inside the fundamental domain

RelPosition.html#localPoint.title: localPoint :Point
RelPosition.html#localPoint.name: localPoint
RelPosition.html#localPoint.description: The underlying local point (i.e. ignoring the cell boost)

RelPosition.html#point.title: point :Point
RelPosition.html#point.name: point
RelPosition.html#point.description: The underlying point (taking into account the cell boost)

RelPosition.html#reduceErrorBoost.title: reduceErrorBoost()  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#reduceErrorBoost.name: reduceErrorBoost
RelPosition.html#reduceErrorBoost.description: Reduce the eventual numerical error of the current boost.

RelPosition.html#reduceErrorFacing.title: reduceErrorFacing()  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#reduceErrorFacing.name: reduceErrorFacing
RelPosition.html#reduceErrorFacing.description: Reduce the eventual numerical error of the current facing.

RelPosition.html#reduceErrorLocal.title: reduceErrorLocal()  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#reduceErrorLocal.name: reduceErrorLocal
RelPosition.html#reduceErrorLocal.description: Reduce the eventual numerical error of the current facing.

RelPosition.html#reduceErrorCellBoost.title: reduceErrorCellBoost()  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#reduceErrorCellBoost.name: reduceErrorCellBoost
RelPosition.html#reduceErrorCellBoost.description: Reduce the eventual numerical error of the current boost.

RelPosition.html#reduceError.title: reduceError()  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#reduceError.name: reduceError
RelPosition.html#reduceError.description: Reduce the eventual numerical error of the current position.

RelPosition.html#applyQuaternion.title: applyQuaternion( quaternion )  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#applyQuaternion.name: applyQuaternion
RelPosition.html#applyQuaternion.description: Rotate the facing by m (right action of O(3) in the set of positions).

RelPosition.html#teleport.title: teleport()  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#teleport.name: teleport
RelPosition.html#teleport.description: Apply if needed a teleportation to bring back the local boos in the fundamental domain

RelPosition.html#flow.title: flow( v )  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#flow.name: flow
RelPosition.html#flow.description: Flow the current position. v is the pull back at the origin by the position of the direction in which we flow The time by which we flow is the norm of v This method makes sure that the boost stays in the fundamental domain

RelPosition.html#eyes.name: eyes
RelPosition.html#eyes.description: Return the two positions corresponding to the left and right eye.

RelPosition.html#equals.name: equals
RelPosition.html#equals.description: Check if the current position and position are the same. Mainly for debugging purposes

RelPosition.html#clone.title: clone()  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#clone.name: clone
RelPosition.html#clone.description: Return a new copy of the current position.

RelPosition.html#copy.title: copy( position )  {RelPosition}
RelPosition.html#copy.name: copy
RelPosition.html#copy.description: Set the current position with the given position.

RelPosition.html#toGLSL.name: toGLSL
RelPosition.html#toGLSL.description: Return a line of GLSL code creating the same position. Used when dynamically building shaders.

Subgroup.html.title: Subgroup
Subgroup.html.name: Subgroup
Subgroup.html.description: We describe a discrete subgroups by a set of generator. Each generator is seen as a teleportation (to move a point back in the fundamental domain). Thus a discrete subgroups is described by a list of teleportations. The order of those teleportations is the order in which the teleportation are performed. This plays an important role if the discrete subgroups is not abelian. A possible extension would be to implement a symbolic representation of the elements in the subgroup. For the lattices we implemented in E^3, S^3, S^2 x E, Nil and Sol this is probably easy. Indeed E^3, the lattice will be a semi-direct product of Z^2 by a finite group. S^3 the lattice is a finite group S^2 x E the lattice is the product of a finite group and Z Nil and Sol, the lattices we used are semi-direct product of Z^2 and Z In those case we still need to define our own structures : OpenGL does not handle integer matrices for instance. For H^3, H^2 x E and SL(2,R) this is not that obvious : OpenGL does not seem to handle strings. One possibility would be to find a representations of those groups in GL(n, A) where A is a number field. We could define our structures to handle formally this number field (probably not too bad in terms of performances) And then matrices in this number field. The advantage (compare to a word representation) are the following: Going from the symbolic representation to the actual Isometry would be straightforward. Checking the equality of tow elements in the lattice should be straight forward.

Subgroup.html#teleports.title: teleports :Array.<Teleport>
Subgroup.html#teleports.name: teleports
Subgroup.html#teleports.description: The list of teleports "generating" the subgroups. The order matters (see the class description).

Subgroup.html#shader.title: shader()
Subgroup.html#shader.name: shader
Subgroup.html#shader.description: Goes through all the teleportations in the discrete subgroup and build the GLSL code performing the associated test.

FlyControls.html.title: FlyControls
FlyControls.html.name: FlyControls
FlyControls.html.description: Implements controls to fly in the geometry using the keyboard. This is inspired from Three.js FlyControls

FlyControls.html#onKeyDown.title: onKeyDown( event )
FlyControls.html#onKeyDown.name: onKeyDown
FlyControls.html#onKeyDown.description: Event handler when a key is pressed

FlyControls.html#onKeyUp.title: onKeyUp( event )
FlyControls.html#onKeyUp.name: onKeyUp
FlyControls.html#onKeyUp.description: Event handler when a key is pressed

FlyControls.html#update.title: update( delta )
FlyControls.html#update.name: update
FlyControls.html#update.description: Function to update the position Assume that the current position is (g,m) where g is the boost, i.e. subgroup element * local boost m is the facing, i.e. an element of O(3) Denote by a the Matrix4 representing the Three.js camera orientation, understood as an element of O(3) as well. Denote by e = (e1, e2, e3) the reference frame in the tangent space at the origin. Then the frame at p = go attach to the camera is f = d_og . m . a . e That is the camera is looking at the direction -f3 = - d_og . m . a . e3 Assume now that we want to move in the direction of v = (v1,v2,v3) where the vector is given in the frame f, i.e. v = v1. f1 + v2 . f2 + v3. f3. We need to flow the current position in the direction w, where w corresponds to v written in the "position frame", i.e. d_og . m . e. In other words w = a . u, where u = v1 . e1 + v2 . e2 + v3 . e3. Note that we do not change the camera orientation. A similar strategy works for the rotations.
